body_content.explanation: an occasion when an actor reads part of a script, does a short piece of acting, etc. in front of a camera to see if he or she is suitable for a part:
examples: They flew him to London for a screen test.
She had screen tests for leading roles in Tomb Raider and Charlie's Angels but failed to win either part.

body_content.explanation: to do a short piece of acting in front of a camera in order to see if you are suitable for a part in a film or TV show:
examples: We wondered if you might be interested in screen-testing for a part in a new sitcom.
He is thought to have been approached to screen-test before Armstrong but said he was not interested.

body_content.explanation: to ask someone to do a short piece of acting in front of a camera in order to see if they are suitable for a part in a film or TV show:
examples: They began screen-testing actors for the role in May.
The people who made this movie said they were going to screen-test some people.
